item.title: 贝莱德认为 CLO 是欧洲最佳信贷机会之一
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：Collateralized loan obligations in Europe look appealing as bond spreads grind tighter, according to BlackRock Inc.】

item.title: 美联储巴尔提出大银行压力测试的替代改革方案
item.description: 美联储理事迈克尔-巴尔（Michael Barr）表示，银行资本水平的设定应与压力测试结果分开，并根据贷款人的状况进行更紧密的定制。【原文：Setting bank capital levels should be separated from stress test results and customized more closely to a lender’s condition, according to Fed Governor Michael Barr, who is looking for ways to preserve the rigor of the tests amid calls from the industry to make them easier.】

item.title: 大科技公司代价高昂的人工智能竞赛助长了数千亿美元的债务交易
item.description: 需要大量资金来实现人工智能雄心的科技公司正在以数年来最快的速度进行大宗债务交易，利用投资者近乎 "贪得无厌 "的胃口，为那些最终回报仍不确定的计划锁定融资。【原文：Technology firms with vast funding needs to pay for their AI ambitions are striking blockbuster debt deals at the fastest pace in years, taking advantage of near—insatiable investor appetite to lock in financing for initiatives whose ultimate payoff remains uncertain.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚的优质品牌面临巴西廉价咖啡的威胁
item.description: 随着巴西咖啡豆因唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的苛刻关税而大量涌入哥伦比亚，哥伦比亚的咖啡业正处于动荡之中。【原文：Colombia’s coffee sector is in turmoil as Brazilian beans flood into the country in response to Donald Trump’s crippling tariffs.】

item.title: 巴克莱认为，尽管面临非同寻常的威胁，美元仍将保持活力
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）称，美元近几个月的相对强势证明，尽管面临经济疲软的威胁和美联储自主权受到挑战，但支撑美元的基本面依然完好。【原文：The dollar’s relative strength in recent months is evidence that the fundamentals supporting the greenback are intact despite the threat of a weak economy and challenges to the Federal Reserve’s autonomy, according to Barclays Plc.】

item.title: 罗根称美联储应考虑取代基准基金利率
item.description: 达拉斯联邦储备银行行长洛里-洛根（Lorie Logan）表示，美国央行应放弃将联邦基金利率作为实施货币政策的基准，而应考虑将隔夜利率与美国国债抵押贷款这一更为强劲的市场挂钩。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Lorie Logan said the US central bank should abandon the federal funds rate as its benchmark in implementing monetary policy, and consider an overnight rate tied to the more robust market for loans collateralized by US Treasuries.】

item.title: 仇恨组织利用特朗普的反法命令进行网络威胁
item.description: 据追踪仇恨组织的研究人员称，在保守派活动家查理-柯克（Charlie Kirk）去世后，网络极端分子正围绕唐纳德-特朗普总统将反法组织（Antifa）指定为国内恐怖组织而团结起来，这引发了人们对社交媒体骚扰可能演变成暴力的担忧。【原文：Online extremists are rallying around President Donald Trump’s designation of Antifa as a domestic terrorist organization following conservative activist Charlie Kirk’s death, raising concerns that social media harassment could turn violent, according to researchers who track hate groups.】

item.title: 法拉奇就数字英镑计划与英格兰银行发生争执
item.description: 英国改革党领袖奈杰尔-法拉奇（Nigel Farage）指责英格兰银行在为英国建立数字英镑方面的行为 "令人震惊"，称这代表了国家对公民生活的过度干预。【原文：Reform UK Leader Nigel Farage accused the Bank of England of “appalling” conduct in its efforts to establish a digital pound for the UK, saying it represents an overreach of the state into citizens’ lives.】

item.title: ChatGPT 功能为用户提供个性化每日简报
item.description: OpenAI 正在推出一项新的 ChatGPT 功能，根据用户之前与聊天机器人的对话，每天向用户发送一组个性化的新闻、研究和其他更新，这是使其旗舰产品更加主动的一次早期尝试。【原文：OpenAI is rolling out a new ChatGPT feature that sends users a set of personalized news, research and other updates each day based on their prior conversations with the chatbot, an early attempt at making its flagship product more proactive.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟迅速回购债务遭行业组织抨击
item.description: 一个债券持有人行业组织指责华纳兄弟发现公司及其银行家在今年早些时候回购数十亿美元债券时损害了债权人的利益。【原文：A bondholder industry group has accused Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. and its bankers of undermining creditors when the company repurchased billions of dollars of its bonds earlier this year.】

item.title: 博世裁员 13,000 人，德国工业危机加剧
item.description: 罗伯特-博世公司（Robert Bosch GmbH）计划削减 13,000 个额外的工作岗位，这表明德国汽车工业的衰落正如何波及欧洲最大的经济体。【原文：Robert Bosch GmbH’s plan to slash 13,000 additional jobs shows how the German auto industry’s decline is rippling through Europe’s biggest economy.】

item.title: Citadel 的格里芬称美联储今年可能再减产一次
item.description: Citadel 的 Ken Griffin 说，他预计美联储将在 2025 年再次下调基准利率，因为该央行将把重点转向劳动力市场。【原文：Citadel’s Ken Griffin said he expects the Federal Reserve to cut its benchmark rate once more in 2025 as the central bank turns its focus to the labor market.】

item.title: 英国交易员在美国内幕交易案中被要求支付 770 万美元
item.description: 在一起民事案件中，美国证券交易委员会命令一名伦敦交易员支付 770 万美元，该交易员因内幕交易指控被引渡至美国，并成功抗诉。【原文：A London trader who successfully fought extradition to the US on insider trading charges, was ordered to pay $7.7 million in a civil case by the US Securities and Exchange Commission.】

item.title: 高盛警告股市波动，催化剂值得玩味
item.description: 市场正提心吊胆地等待美联储的下一步利率举措，关键的财报季迫在眉睫，美国政府关门的威胁也日益严重。【原文：The market is on tenterhooks waiting for the Federal Reserve’s next interest-rate move, a crucial earnings season looms large and the threat of a US government shutdown is growing more severe.】

item.title: 美国政府将对成本激增的农业投入供应商进行审查
item.description: 美国农业部长布鲁克-罗林斯（Brooke Rollins）表示，美国将对种子和化肥等农作物投入品供应商可能违反反垄断法的行为进行调查，因为农民们正在与高昂的生产成本作斗争。【原文：The US will investigate suppliers of crop inputs such as seeds and fertilizers for potential antitrust violations, as farmers struggle with high production costs, according to Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins.】

item.title: 博茨瓦纳举行钻石拍卖会筹集资金
item.description: 博茨瓦纳正在举行一场史无前例的临时钻石拍卖会，以期在全球宝石市场不景气的情况下为本国经济筹集资金。【原文：Botswana is holding an unprecedented ad-hoc diamond auction, in a bid to raise money as its economy suffers from a slump in the global gem market.】

item.title: 南非的卡冈亚戈说 "危险 "的世界需要监管
item.description: 南非储备银行行长莱塞特贾-卡尼亚戈（Lesetja Kganyago）表示，加密货币泡沫的威胁和许多国家的高债务水平是抵制放松金融监管压力的原因之一。【原文：South African Reserve Bank Governor Lesetja Kganyago said the threat of a crypto-currency bubble and high debt levels in many nations were among reasons to resist pressure for financial deregulation.】

item.title: 需求下降，液化天然气船堆积在埃及码头附近
item.description: 三艘液化天然气船正在埃及的进口码头外等候，因为调度问题和北非国家的季节性需求下降速度超过预期，导致对这种燃料的需求减少。【原文：Three liquefied natural gas vessels are waiting outside Egypt’s import terminals as scheduling issues and a faster-than-expected seasonal demand decline in the North African nation reduces need for the fuel.】

item.title: 厄瓜多尔投资者押注诺沃亚将坚持削减补贴
item.description: 厄瓜多尔前两任总统都曾试图削减苛刻的柴油补贴，但都因群众抗议而被迫放弃。现在，丹尼尔-诺沃亚（Daniel Noboa）再次做出尝试，而债券投资者则打赌他会坚持到底。【原文：Ecuador’s past two presidents both tried to slash onerous diesel subsidies, only to be forced into climb-downs by mass protests. Now Daniel Noboa is trying again, and bond investors are betting he will stay the course.】

item.title: 微软根据 "大规模监控 "规则禁止以色列使用部分软件
item.description: 有新闻报道称，微软公司的产品参与了对平民的监视，在调查之后，微软公司禁止以色列军方使用其部分软件。【原文：Microsoft Corp., disabled some use of its software by the Israeli military after an investigation spurred by news reports that the company’s products were involved in the surveillance of civilians.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率自七月以来首次上调
item.description: 美国的抵押贷款利率上升，在连续下降后改变了方向。【原文：Mortgage rates in the US rose, shifting direction after a steady string of declines.】

item.title: 房地美美国 30 年期抵押贷款利率升至 6.3
item.description: 房地美数据显示，截至 9 月 25 日的一周，30 年期固定抵押贷款利率从 6.26% 上升至 6.3%。15 年期利率平均为 5.49%，高于一周前的 5.41%："在本周早些时候发布的一份报告中，MBA 称，截至上周五的一周内，30 年期固定利率为 6.34%。【原文：The 30-year fixed mortgage rate for week ending Sept. 25 rose to 6.3% from 6.26%, Freddie Mac data show. 15-year rate avg 5.49%, up from 5.41% a week earlierFrom the report: "Following several weeks of decline, mortgage rates inched up this week”“Housing market activity continues to hold up with purchase and refinance applications increasing"In a report out earlier this week MBA said the 30-year fixed rate was 6.34% for the week ending last Friday】

item.title: 美国出口销售增幅超过预期，谷物期货上涨
item.description: 美国政府公布的周出口销售额超过分析师预期后，芝加哥期货交易所的小麦和玉米期货上涨。【原文：Wheat and corn futures rose on the Chicago Board of Trade after the US government reported weekly export sales that beat analyst estimates.】

item.title: 乌克兰根据美国资源协议提出首个能源项目
item.description: 乌克兰最大的石油和天然气公司正在推介几个项目，这些项目可能成为与美国达成的资源协议的首批项目之一，以支撑其战时经济，并帮助获得唐纳德-特朗普总统的支持。【原文：Ukraine’s biggest oil and gas company is pitching several projects that could be among the first under a resource deal with the US to shore up its wartime economy and help secure support from President Donald Trump.】

item.title: Meta 将面对欧盟认定其未能对非法职位进行监管的结果
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc.将面临欧盟的指控，原因是该公司未能充分监管非法内容，有可能因违反欧盟的内容审核规则而被罚款。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. is set to face a charge sheet from the European Union for failing to adequately police illegal content, risking fines for violating the bloc’s content moderation rulebook.】

item.title: 大众汽车因更新柴油排放装置的合法性而败诉
item.description: 大众汽车公司（Volkswagen AG）和德国交通监管机构 KBA 未能推翻下级法院的裁决，该裁决撤销了监管机构对一种软件装置的批准，该装置可根据温度停用柴油发动机的排放清洁功能。【原文：Volkswagen AG and Germany’s transport regulator KBA failed to overturn a lower court ruling that quashed a regulatory approval of a software device that deactivates emission cleaning in diesel engines depending on temperature.】

item.title: 亚马逊与美国联邦贸易委员会就 Prime 订阅案达成 25 亿美元协议
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）同意支付 25 亿美元的罚款和退款，并改变其取消 Prime 订阅的程序，以解决美国联邦贸易委员会的诉讼。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. agreed to pay $2.5 billion in penalties and refunds and change its process for how to cancel its Prime subscription to settle a lawsuit by the US Federal Trade Commission.】

item.title: 纳米比亚将欧洲债券再融资任务授予三家本地银行
item.description: 纳米比亚财政部已指定三家国内贷款机构帮助其筹集约 1.22 亿美元，为下个月到期的 7.5 亿美元欧元债券的一部分再融资。【原文：Namibia’s Finance Ministry has appointed three domestic lenders to help it raise about $122 million to refinance a portion of its $750 million eurobond due next month.】

item.title: 欧洲 9 月债券销售额突破 2,000 亿欧元，创历史新高
item.description: 随着从主权国家到高收益公司的借款人充分利用有利条件，欧洲公共债务市场的发行量创下了 9 月份的新纪录。【原文：Issuance in Europe’s public debt market has set a new September record as borrowers from sovereigns to high-yield companies make the most of favorable conditions.】

item.title: 不可替代 "的创始人马克-莱昂纳德辞职，Constellation 软件公司业绩下滑
item.description: 加拿大第二大科技公司 Constellation Software Inc. 的创始人兼总裁马克-伦纳德（Mark Leonard）周四表示，由于健康原因，他将立即辞职。这一消息导致该公司股价下滑，评级也随之下调。【原文：Mark Leonard, founder and president of Canada’s second-largest tech company Constellation Software Inc., is resigning immediately for health reasons, the company said Thursday. The announcement sent the firm’s shares sliding and prompted a downgrade.】
